Snapwiz is an education technology organisation empowering personalised learning with next generation of digital learning solutions.


Snapwiz empowers educators with smarter assessment, interactive, collaborative and adaptive learning widgets that transforms teaching and improves efficacy and also provides customized  learning paths that could match individuals unique learning style. Snapwiz also has introduced robust learning tools to enhance classroom workflow and educators can customize their curriculum to meet their needs.


Products of Snapwiz:

Snapwiz products to Students:

Snapwiz provides interactive texts to students that helps to take the control on their own learning process. Interactive texts are broken to chapters and sub chapters and assignments. Interactive texts helps students engage to take notes, highlight passages, and share comments with their instructors. Students are also provided access to detailed Assessment History which provides an opportunity to view their efforts, skill reports, create their own practice tests and performance reports are displayed  in a detailed dashboard that finally guides students to take control of their own assessment insights.


Snapwiz products to Instructors:

Instructors are empowered with adaptive and collaborative learning assessment tools that make evaluation simple. It helps to view how students interact with content, view the learning behavior of students and provide them right feedback.

Dinesh,

First Release

  We created the manager users using POST => /api/v1/users ( where we have complete control, we can set "can_enroll" & "can_mark_complete" attributes as well )

      It had a problem with existing users ( Users from other learn upon portals )

Current Release

     But unfortunately it doesn't support "can_enroll" & "can_mark_complete" attributes ( which means those two attributes remain with default values can_enroll=true, can_mark_complete = false )

ref : LearnUpon API V1 documentation

108.html:
There are two ways to register a user in Learn Upon ( Registration, Invites ).

  1. POST => /api/v1/users

      which accept the following attributes
      {
            first_name,
            last_name,
            email,
            password,
            user_type,
            enabled,
            language,
            can_enroll,
            can_mark_complete
      }

      You have the complete control over the newly created user.


  2. POST => /api/v1/group_invites

      which accept the following attributes
      {
            email_addresses,
            group_id,
            group_membership_type_id
      }

      As you can see, you have no control over the rest of the user attributes ( like you cannot set "can_enroll" or "can_mark_complete" ).


So whats wrong with the first method ( Registration )

    Here is the scenario ( our Learn Upon portal is - stcs.learnupon.com )

    First method is the ideal solution If the user is new to Lear Upon.

    But I am buying a course and I would like to enroll that course for a User ( let's say sark@sarkware.com ) who is already a member of Some other Learn Upon Portal ( sark.learnupon.com )

    In that case we cannot Use the Registration method ( 1 method ) because the user is already a member of sark.learnupon.com ( that's why, that registration failed 'sc@resolution-resourcing.co.uk' during our First Release ).

    Our only option is group_invites, which is ideal for both scenarios ( new as well as existing user ), but unfortunately that comes with it's own limitation ( we cannot set "can_enroll", "can_mark_complete" attributes ).



Regards
Sark

113.html:
Hi,

I understand your concern.

Also you have some misunderstanding on how Shopify Apps work ( or where it is hosted ).

    First of all, Shopify never host any application on their sercver. ( They are just listing them, they don't do hosting  ).
    All the apps you are seeing in Shopify Apps Store are hosted in their own servers ( mostly in Amazon, Heroku or Digital Ocean ).
    Your concern about My server ( which is Digital Ocean ) is also equally applicable for any of the Shopify App ( since they are also hosted with their own server ).

That's how the system works.
No one can guarantee 100% up time ( not even shopify, their server is going for maintenance monthly at least twice ).

I would create a separate instance in my Digital Ocean account for your site alone. ( Since youare the first official customer for this app ).
Once it got approved and listed in Shopify App store, I myself upgrade your site with the Official Rapid Filter instance.



Regards
Sark





On Wednesday 18 March 2015 10:04 AM, Santosh Tamhane wrote:
5.4
If the app is hosted on Shopify, we have no issues. Our concern is that until such time, should (God forbid) anything happen by which you can no longer access the code, we should have some kind of access to it to allow our business continuity.  We are not interested in the source code per se.Typically the code is kept in escrow location with a third party where access is provided only under certain condition. If you have any similar or other solution to take care of our concern , let me know. 

7.
Not sure what the concern is here. All we are saying is that we will continue to hold rights to USE the functionality even if our website or business model changes. We make no claims on your IP and you can continue to use it as you deem necessary without any claim on it from us. If you have better wordings for this, please feel free to edit.

You may call me at +91-8691000550 if you want to discuss. However we do want to get going on this asap and bringing this to closure and moving to the next step will be highly appreciated.

regds
Santosh

On Wed, Mar 18, 2015 at 7:55 PM, Saravana Kumar K <sark@sarkware.com> wrote:
Hi,

I understand your concern.

Also you have some misunderstanding on how Shopify Apps work ( or where it is hosted ).

    First of all, Shopify never host any application on their sercver. ( They are just listing them, they don't do hosting  ).
    All the apps you are seeing in Shopify Apps Store are hosted in their own servers ( mostly in Amazon, Heroku or Digital Ocean ).
    Your concern about My server ( which is Digital Ocean ) is also equally applicable for any of the Shopify App ( since they are also hosted with their own server ).

That's how the system works.
No one can guarantee 100% up time ( not even shopify, their server is going for maintenance monthly at least twice ).

I would create a separate instance in my Digital Ocean account for your site alone. ( Since youare the first official customer for this app ).
Once it got approved and listed in Shopify App store, I myself upgrade your site with the Official Rapid Filter instance.



Regards
Sark

On Tuesday 24 March 2015 05:14 AM, Kieran Barnes wrote:

Hi Kieran, 

 

Thanks for your response. Yes, here's what I had in mind for Woo, although the problem with this idea so far is that Woo's Dynamic Pricing Advanced Category Pricing doesn't show a title for each rule and what the discount is. Attached is an example of what the product discount rules look like in their existing Prestashop shop. If something like that were possible with Woo, that would be nice.

 

Integration needed: 

  • Product sync between OrderWise (OW), and Woocommerce (Woo), so that if product details are changed in OrderWise, those new changes will be sent to update the product details in Woo. Details include:
    • Product title 
    • Product SKU (there are currently 3,657 products)
    • Product category (currently SNS has 379 product categories)
    • Product description
    • Product price (just the regular price)
    • Product dimensions
    • Product weight
    • Product inventory (really important)
  • Order export from Woocommerce and imported into OrderWise, so that the order can be picked and shipped. Once it is exported from Woo and imported into OW, nothing further needs to be communicated back to Woo unless the order is canceled. Then syncing that cancellation back to Woo would be good, if possible.
  • Any orders placed "offline" via the physical store and OrderWise, need to sync updated inventory levels for the products sold to the website so that inventory on the website is accurate. Syncing the entire order details from OW to Woo would be nice but not required.
  • Discounts (very important):
    • SNS (the client) has special pricing for groups of customers, providing unique category discounts (in % off regular price) for customers in those discount groups. Currently, SNS has 203 of these groups. 
      • I have the Dynamic Pricing extension for Woocommerce that would help handle these calculations (you can see an example setup in Woocommerce > Dynamic Pricing > Category > Advanced Category Pricing...also shown in attached screenshot). The category discounts from each group would just need to be synced from OW to Woo (so that any changes made in OW would be synced to Woo).
      • The custom customer groups from OW would have to be synced with new custom user roles in Wordpress. (I have WPFront User Role Editor that may be able to help with that.) 
      • Example: if a SNS sales rep creates a new customer - Joe - in OW and assigns Joe to the discount group "Best Buys: Level 2", Joe's info needs to be synced to Wordpress, creating his profile with his name and email, and assigning his user role to "Best Buys: Level 2". If that role doesn't already exist, it needs to be created so he can be assigned to it. Once he is assigne to that role, he will be able to see all the product/category discounts when he is logged into the website.
    • SNS also has bulk discounts for products and product categories. 

Thanks,


 

 


--
Saravana Kumar K
Professional Software & Web Developer
Website : sarkware.com
Phone : +(91) 44 42639374
Mobile : +(91) 9791076616
Skype : sarkware

Integration needed: 

  • Product sync between OrderWise (OW), and Woocommerce (Woo), so that if product details are changed in OrderWise, those new changes will be sent to update the product details in Woo. Details include:
    • Product title 
    • Product SKU (there are currently 3,657 products)
    • Product category (currently SNS has 379 product categories)
    • Product description
    • Product price (just the regular price)
    • Product dimensions
    • Product weight
    • Product inventory (really important)
  • Order export from Woocommerce and imported into OrderWise, so that the order can be picked and shipped. Once it is exported from Woo and imported into OW, nothing further needs to be communicated back to Woo unless the order is canceled. Then syncing that cancellation back to Woo would be good, if possible.
  • Any orders placed "offline" via the physical store and OrderWise, need to sync updated inventory levels for the products sold to the website so that inventory on the website is accurate. Syncing the entire order details from OW to Woo would be nice but not required.
  • Discounts (very important):
    • SNS (the client) has special pricing for groups of customers, providing unique category discounts (in % off regular price) for customers in those discount groups. Currently, SNS has 203 of these groups. 
      • I have the Dynamic Pricing extension for Woocommerce that would help handle these calculations (you can see an example setup in Woocommerce > Dynamic Pricing > Category > Advanced Category Pricing...also shown in attached screenshot). The category discounts from each group would just need to be synced from OW to Woo (so that any changes made in OW would be synced to Woo).
      • The custom customer groups from OW would have to be synced with new custom user roles in Wordpress. (I have WPFront User Role Editor that may be able to help with that.) 
      • Example: if a SNS sales rep creates a new customer - Joe - in OW and assigns Joe to the discount group "Best Buys: Level 2", Joe's info needs to be synced to Wordpress, creating his profile with his name and email, and assigning his user role to "Best Buys: Level 2". If that role doesn't already exist, it needs to be created so he can be assigned to it. Once he is assigne to that role, he will be able to see all the product/category discounts when he is logged into the website.
    • SNS also has bulk discounts for products and product categories.

133.html:
There are two ways to register a user in Learn Upon ( Registration, Invites ).

  1. POST => /api/v1/users

      which accept the following attributes
      {
            first_name,
            last_name,
            email,
            password,
            user_type,
            enabled,
            language,
            can_enroll,
            can_mark_complete
      }

      You have the complete control over the newly created user.
      But it also comes with it's own disadvantage,

            It never sent user account confirmation email ( or ) at least a welcome email, at the time registering a new user through Registration API ( must be a learndash bug ).
            So we need to sent the welcome email ( along with username & passoword ) manually, just for one time only ( that's why we need a proper smtp details ).
            If we use the proper smtp server & user details, it never goes to spam folder. ( test-cgvak@gmail.com definitely goes to spam )


  2. POST => /api/v1/group_invites

      which accept the following attributes
      {
            email_addresses,
            group_id,
            group_membership_type_id
      }

      As you can see, you have no control over the rest of the user attributes ( like you cannot set "can_enroll" or "can_mark_complete" ).


So whats wrong with the first method ( Registration )

    Here is the scenario ( our Learn Upon portal is - stcs.learnupon.com )

    First method is the ideal solution If the user is new to Lear Upon.

    But I am buying a course and I would like to enroll that course for a User ( let's say sark@sarkware.com ) who is already a member of Some other Learn Upon Portal ( sark.learnupon.com )

    In that case we cannot Use the Registration method ( 1 method ) because the user is already a member of sark.learnupon.com ( that's why, that registration failed 'sc@resolution-resourcing.co.uk' during our First Release ).

    Our only option is group_invites, which is ideal for both scenarios ( new as well as existing user ), but unfortunately that comes with it's own limitation ( we cannot set "can_enroll", "can_mark_complete" attributes ).



Regards
Sark



--

Hi,

I understand your concern.

Also you have some misunderstanding on how Shopify Apps work ( or where it is hosted ).

    First of all, Shopify never host any application on their sercver. ( They are just listing them, they don't do hosting  ).
    All the apps you are seeing in Shopify Apps Store are hosted in their own servers ( mostly in Amazon, Heroku or Digital Ocean ).
    Your concern about My server ( which is Digital Ocean ) is also equally applicable for any of the Shopify App ( since they are also hosted with their own server ).

That's how the system works.
No one can guarantee 100% up time ( not even shopify, their server is going for maintenance monthly at least twice ).

I would create a separate instance in my Digital Ocean account for your site alone. ( Since youare the first official customer for this app ).
Once it got approved and listed in Shopify App store, I myself upgrade your site with the Official Rapid Filter instance.



Regards
Sark

On Wed, Mar 18, 2015 at 7:55 PM, Saravana Kumar K <sark@sarkware.com> wrote:
Hi,

I understand your concern.

Also you have some misunderstanding on how Shopify Apps work ( or where it is hosted ).

    First of all, Shopify never host any application on their sercver. ( They are just listing them, they don't do hosting  ).
    All the apps you are seeing in Shopify Apps Store are hosted in their own servers ( mostly in Amazon, Heroku or Digital Ocean ).
    Your concern about My server ( which is Digital Ocean ) is also equally applicable for any of the Shopify App ( since they are also hosted with their own server ).

That's how the system works.
No one can guarantee 100% up time ( not even shopify, their server is going for maintenance monthly at least twice ).

I would create a separate instance in my Digital Ocean account for your site alone. ( Since youare the first official customer for this app ).
Once it got approved and listed in Shopify App store, I myself upgrade your site with the Official Rapid Filter instance.



Regards
Sark

Hi,

I understand your concern.

Also you have some misunderstanding on how Shopify Apps work ( or where it is hosted ).

    First of all, Shopify never host any application on their sercver. ( They are just listing them, they don't do hosting  ).
    All the apps you are seeing in Shopify Apps Store are hosted in their own servers ( mostly in Amazon, Heroku or Digital Ocean ).
    Your concern about My server ( which is Digital Ocean ) is also equally applicable for any of the Shopify App ( since they are also hosted with their own server ).

That's how the system works.
No one can guarantee 100% up time ( not even shopify, their server is going for maintenance monthly at least twice ).

I would create a separate instance in my Digital Ocean account for your site alone. ( Since youare the first official customer for this app ).

Sark

On Wed, Mar 18, 2015 at 7:55 PM, Saravana Kumar K <sark@sarkware.com> wrote:
Hi,

I understand your concern.

Also you have some misunderstanding on how Shopify Apps work ( or where it is hosted ).

    First of all, Shopify never host any application on their sercver. ( They are just listing them, they don't do hosting  ).
    All the apps you are seeing in Shopify Apps Store are hosted in their own servers ( mostly in Amazon, Heroku or Digital Ocean ).
    Your concern about My server ( which is Digital Ocean ) is also equally applicable for any of the Shopify App ( since they are also hosted with their own server ).

That's how the system works.
No one can guarantee 100% up time ( not even shopify, their server is going for maintenance monthly at least twice ).

I would create a separate instance in my Digital Ocean account for your site alone. ( Since youare the first official customer for this app ).
Once it got approved and listed in Shopify App store, I myself upgrade your site with the Official Rapid Filter instance.



Regards
Sark

Hi,

I have finished the customization, and I have attached the functions.php file, pls go through the source code and validate it. Especially the pricing calculation.

The flow is

1. Adding custom fields to product page ( for particular product categories only )
2. Validating "Aantal" & "Enveloppen"
3. Add custom fields data to cart line item
4. Calculating Line price
5. Adding custom fields data to order review table ( It won't work since your woo version is 2.0 )
6. Adding custom fields data to Order Meta.

I would recommend to use Woocommerce 2.2.1 at least ( Latest version is 2.3 ).

If this is not what you expect, I have your older functions.php as it is, we can revert back, no problem.
